meanings.sent1: He felt shafted when his friend took credit for his idea.
meanings.sent2: She knew she was being shafted by the salesman with false promises.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt shafted when the dog got a bigger treat.
meanings.sent4: The students felt shafted when the teacher gave extra credit to only a few.
meanings.sent5: Being shafted by a close friend can hurt deeply.

meanings.definition: A long, narrow part or section
meanings.sent1: The arrow had a sharp shaft that flew straight.
meanings.sent2: The shaft of light illuminated the dark room.
meanings.sent3: The shaft of the key fit perfectly into the lock.
meanings.sent4: The elevator descended down the shaft smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The miner descended into the dark shaft to extract coal.

meanings.sent1: The blacksmith shafted the arrowheads for the archers.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic shafted the engine with precision.
meanings.sent3: The chef shafted the skewers with meat for the barbecue.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter shafted the handle onto the tool.
meanings.sent5: The craftsman shafted the spear for battle.
